Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the impact of the gas tax increase on traffic, stating that it will make traffic worse without providing enough evidence to support this claim.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient evidence or data to support the assertion that the gas tax increase will not increase road capacity or build new lanes of freeways.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the purpose of the gas tax increase is to address traffic congestion and build new lanes, while the actual goal of the legislation is to fund road repairs and maintenance.
Exist alternative explanation: There is an alternative explanation provided by supporters of the gas tax increase, who argue that it is necessary to address California's road repair backlog and improve the state's economy.
